condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 6.2: UNICEF and staff partners are provided with tools, guidance and resources for effective advocacy on child rights issues.

description.narrative: UNICEF Sudan Country Office made tremendous strides for global reach through offline, digital and traditional media. This was done through statements, videos, interviews, advocacy events and influencing creative content. Social media platforms were verified, and the Sudan website was launched. The team advocated for Sudan's Prime Minister to recommit to The Convention on the rights of the child agreement. Many CRC activities were held through workshops and events throughout Sudan with other UN and INGO agencies. New creative partnerships were established. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

Number of people that take action in support of UNICEF (through volunteering, online supporters, sponsoring, memberships, pledges, etc.) - Facebook
Number of people reached by UNICEF messages through offline events
Number of cross-sectoral public advocacy initiatives with partners to promote the rights of children in the Sudan
Number of existing planned events that integrate CRC messages.
